intro: Lactuca cyprica, commonly known as Caucasian lettuce, is a species of annual herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically pale green to blue-green in color. The plant produces small yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which is typical of the daisy family. It is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats and is adapted to cooler climates. Lactuca cyprica is cultivated for its edible leaves, which have a mild, slightly bitter taste.
